dismissals.name: Bowled
dismissals.description: When the bowler delivers the ball and it hits the batter's stumps.

dismissals.name: Caught
dismissals.description: If the batsman hits the ball, and the fielder catches it before it touches the ground.

dismissals.name: LBW
dismissals.description: Leg Before Wicket, or LBW, is when the ball hits any part of the batter's body (usually the legs or pads) without hitting the bat, and it would have gone on to hit the stumps.

dismissals.name: LBW
dismissals.description: Try placing the ball to simulate LBW.

dismissals.name: Run Out
dismissals.description: When the batsman is out of the crease line and the fielder hits the stumps.

dismissals.name: Run Out
dismissals.description: Drag the batsman and simulate the dismissal.

dismissals.name: Stumped
dismissals.description: When the batter steps out of their crease to play a shot, misses the ball, and the wicketkeeper quickly removes the bails before they can return.

dismissals.name: Retired Out
dismissals.description: If a batsman leaves the field without the consent of the umpires, the batsman is declared 'Retired Out' if he does not have the permission from the opposing team to resume.

dismissals.name: Double Hit / Hit the Ball Twice
dismissals.description: When a batter hits the ball twice - first legally and the second time intentionally.

dismissals.name: Hit Wicket
dismissals.description: If the batsman while attempting to strike the ball or taking off for a run, hits the wicket and knocks the stumps off, he is given 'Hit Wicket' out.

dismissals.name: Obstructing the Field
dismissals.description: If a batsman by action or words, deliberately obstructs or distracts the fielding side, he is given out for obstructing the field. It is a very rare way of dismissal.

dismissals.name: Timed Out
dismissals.description: When a new batsman is about to come in to bat, and he takes more than three minutes to enter the field, he is adjudged out. Same applied if a batsman willfully takes more than 3 minutes to face the next delivery or resume the play after an official drinks/meal break is over.
